info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 23 at 4:00PM EDT until July 23 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT FOR EASTERN FAYETTE...EASTERN MONONGALIA...PRESTON AND SOUTHEASTERN MARION COUNTIES... At 400 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles south of Farmington, or 15 miles north of Kingwood, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Morgantown, Uniontown, Connellsville, Kingwood, Terra Alta, Rowlesburg, Winfield, South Connellsville, Farmington, Newburg, Seven Springs, and Brookhaven. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
